div.p: NAMETYPE is a field in the Bibliography Database which functions in a very similar way to AUTHORNAMETYPE in WRITING sections of entries: it distinguishes between different kinds of authorship, such as anonymous and pseudonymous texts; texts claimed by allusion to other texts; and those authored by more than a single hand. The NAMETYPE field in the Bibliography Database differs in offering two further options: Used and Doubtful (issues which the schema deals with in different ways).
The NAMETYPE field is used only when a writer publishes under a name other than her Standard Name. Select the NAMETYPE which best describes the Name entered in the Published As field.

ul.li: Anonymous -- indicates texts which appeared with no name on the title page or no name attached to them, or with the generic By A Lady
Pseudonymous -- indicates texts published or circulated under a fictional or assumed name
Allusive Authorship -- indicates texts published under a phrase which alludes to other works by that writer -- for example, By the Author of David Simple
Collaborative Authorship -- indicates texts where the title-page lists or other sources supply more than one author name

Used Name -- indicates texts which appeared under some variation of a writer's name which is different from the Standard Name. Used Names are not pseudonyms because they are not fictional or assumed names; Used Names are required when a writer did not publish under her Standard Name. For example, Mary Augusta Ward (Standard Name) published as Mrs Humphry Ward (Used Name).

Doubtful -- indicates issues of acription: misattributions, possible misattributions, and texts which were published under a writer's name but may not have been written by her. The Bibliography Database requires that all bibliogitems be entered under a writer's Standard Name in order to group these texts together. Doubtful indicates that a particular text may well have been misattributed to her; however, this text still needs to be entered in the Bibliography Database linked to her Standard Name in order to group it together with other texts by her.

div.p: Question: My BWW published all of her works under her Standard Name. Do I need to fill out the NAMETYPE field?
Answer: No. Leave the NAMETYPE field at its default, or blank, setting.
